intro: Hieracium setosissimum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, often reddish stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium setosissimum is known for its robust growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types, though it prefers moist, well-drained environments.
